ext_descriptions.ext_description: A predefined_3d_purpose lists the predefined types of the 3d purpose.
specifies the purpose to be an analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be an analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be a shock analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be a shock analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be a design;
specifies the purpose to be a vibration analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be a vibration analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be an electromagnetic compatibility analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be an electromagnetic compatibility analysis output;
specifies the purpose to be a thermal analysis input;
specifies the purpose to be a thermal analysis output.

A pu3ds_component_application lists the
values.
specifies a component application to be compliant components only;
specifies a component application to prohibit components.
A pu3ds_shape_location lists the locations of the shape.
specifies the shape location is above;
specifies the shape location is below.
A pu3ds_shape_side lists the sides of the shape.
specifies the shape is of the same side;
specifies the shape is of the opposite side;
specifies the shape is of both sides.
A shape_class lists the classes of the shape.
specifies shape to be an extrusion;
specifies shape to be a manhattan block;
specifies some other class of a shape;
specifies shape to be unknown.

ext_description.p:
A Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model is a type of
and a type of . A Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model is the shape in three orthogonal dimensions of a keepout constraint for a . Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model extends
with the addition of shape classification and application constraints.
ext_description.note: Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape.
ext_description.p:
When a Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model is applied to a
and additional parameters are provided, those parameters establish the location and orientation of boundaries of the three dimensional shape with respect to the seating plane of the . A processor that generates three dimensional models shall consider the parameters as boundary conditions for the extent of the keepout model. A processor that receives and converts the three dimensional models into an internal representation shall not assume that the three dimensional shape is a simple shape just because the boundary conditions are provided.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 does not assume that the side of the seating plane is related to the side of the interconnect. The normal of the geometric representation of a seating plane is always considered to be in parallel with the normal of the surface of the interconnect being simulated with the seating plane. The seating plane provides no information about the surfaces of the interconnect other than the specific surface being simulated. The determination of the instance relationship between a seating plane and the interconnect surface is accomplished by examining the assembly model to identify a mounting surface and then querying the components that are to be mounted on that surface for their related seating planes.

specifies the
for the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model as extrusion, manhattan_block, other, or is_unknown.

for the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model.
When the value is
it indicates that the
is a constraint on the size of other components that would otherwise be located near the component specified by the
attribute of the
referenced by the
attribute. When the value is , components that do not meet the size constraint specified by this Application Object shall not be in the neighborhood bounded by this Application Object.
When the value is
it indicates that there shall be no components located in the neighborhood of the component specified by the
attribute of the
referenced by the
attribute. That neighborhood is defined by this Application Object.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that is the distance of the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model from the . The shape_distance_from_seating_plane is coordinated with the shape_location_with_respect_to_seating_plane. The extent of the shape model shall be determined starting from the relevant side of the
going to the value specified by the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model.shape_distance_from_seating_plane in the direction of the value of the shape_location_with_respect_to_seating_plane attribute. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The side attribute must be populated for this value to have any meaning.

This part of ISO 10303 supports an interpretation by the receiver that the thickness of the interconnect substrate is accounted for by the receiver when the side attribute is interpreted, since the library data does not contain information about individual designs.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
of the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape_model as 'above', or 'below' the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
specifies either the , , or
as being the side or sides of the interconnect to which the keepout shall be referenced. The side attribute shall be interpreted by a receiver under the context of the component being place on an interconnect substrate. In that context the surface of the interconnect substrate indicated by side shall be used as a datum for measurement. If both sides are indicated the constraint shall be applied to each surface individually.
ext_description.note: This generalizes the concept of seating plane slightly from the limited perspective of the usage view model to the perspective that it is an abstraction of a referenced interconnect substrate surface in that it may be used either on the same side the component is mounted on or may reference the opposite side. The normal application of a seating plane is that it is rigidly tied exactly to the same side as the component is mounted on.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Physical_unit_3d_shape_model is a type of . A Physical_unit_3d_shape_model is the shape in three orthogonal dimensions of a . Physical_unit_3d_shape_model extends
with the addition of shape classification and purpose. A Physical_unit_3d_shape_model may be included for purposes which include the actual shape or boundaries of the actual shape.
ext_description.note: When an extreme boundary of the actual shape is provided, mass property calculations based on the extreme shape may be invalid, depending on the purpose. For example, the centroid location in particular may not be valid for an extreme shape representing the envelope of a mult-mode vibration since the centroid may also vary over a range.

The shape for a
is provided by a , eliminating the requirement to support a shape for a
separately.
